Investigations by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission under the Natural Gas Act and Federal Power Act. The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's authority under the Natural Gas Act is amended to include provisions related to taking evidence, geographic limitations on attendance, witness expenses, and exclusive authority without needing consent from other federal agencies. The Federal Power Act is amended to include provisions related to taking evidence, geographic limitations on attendance, witness expenses, and exclusive authority without needing consent from other federal agencies. The Commission under this subsection is not required to obtain consent from the Office of Management and Budget or any other Federal agency. SEC. 2. INCREASE IN CRIMINAL PENALTIES UNDER THE NATURAL GAS ACT AND FEDERAL POWER ACT. The Natural Gas Act and Federal Power Act are amended to increase criminal penalties. Under the Natural Gas Act, penalties include up to 5 years imprisonment, a fine of up to $1,000,000, or both. Under the Federal Power Act, penalties include a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment for up to two years. The Natural Gas Act and Federal Power Act are amended to increase criminal penalties. Under the Natural Gas Act, penalties include imprisonment for up to 5 years, a fine of up to $1,000,000, or both. Under the Federal Power Act, penalties include a fine of up to $50,000 for each day of each violation. The Natural Gas Act and Federal Power Act are amended to increase criminal penalties, including imprisonment for up to 5 years and fines of up to $1,000,000. The amendments also address non-compliance with written requests for information by the Commission or in formal investigations. The amendments also address non-compliance with written requests for information by the Commission or in formal investigations, with fines increased to $50,000 for each day of each violation. SEC. 3. CONSULTING SERVICES.

The Chairman may contract consultants to assist the Commission in carrying out its responsibilities under various Acts without being subject to certain laws or regulations.
